studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Updated preliminary safety and pharmacokinetic data for GS-0976 in subjects with hepatic impairment.
Updated status and disposition for the Phase 1 hepatic impairment study of GS-9674.

studyAmendmentImpacts.affectedSection: Section 1.6.2 - Rationale for Dose Selection of GS-0976
studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Refined the rationale for dosing in compensated cirrhosis based on updated exposure margins from hepatic impairment studies.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Integration of emerging Phase 1 data regarding hepatic impairment to support the safety and dosing rationale of the investigational products in subjects with advanced fibrosis.
Update study status and preliminary safety results from ongoing combination and single-agent trials (GS-US-426-3988 and GS-US-402-3885).

studyChanges.beforeText: Not explicitly provided in snippet (Ongoing study description)
studyChanges.afterText: As of 17 November 2017, a total of 36 subjects were dosed; 34 subjects had completed study treatment. No subjects prematurely discontinued study treatment.
studyChanges.summary: Updated subject disposition and preliminary safety results for GS-0976 hepatic impairment study.

studyChanges.beforeText: Not explicitly provided in snippet (Previous exposure margin estimates)
studyChanges.afterText: GS-0976 exposures in subjects with mild hepatic impairment (CP A) are expected to remain ≥22 and ≥105-fold lower than the GS-0976 exposures observed at the NOAELs.
studyChanges.summary: Updated exposure margin calculations relative to NOAEL based on preliminary PK data in mild hepatic impairment.

studyChanges.afterText: One subject prematurely discontinued study treatment due to quality issues at the site that justified a suspension in dosing at the site.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified reason for a single subject discontinuation in the GS-9674 Phase 1 study.
